alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Effingham; Shelby (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 02 at 10:25AM CDT until August 02 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN SHELBY...WESTERN CUMBERLAND AND NORTHERN EFFINGHAM COUNTIES... At 1024 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Teutopolis, or near Effingham, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Effingham, Toledo, Neoga, Teutopolis, Greenup, Stewardson, Beecher City, Jewett, Shumway, Montrose, Woodbury, Moccasin, Sigel and Lake Sara. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 between mile markers 157 and 177. Interstate 70 between mile markers 88 and 116. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Lincoln.
